pullRequest.body:
This allows automatic synthesis using typeclasses, see `ZFSet.map`. The new definition is `ZFSet.Definable`. The old `PSet.Definable` has been deprecated.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0938e316da](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16398/commits/0938e316dac6243c64aca10bdbc36cddd0b9c257)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Definable`
`+ Definable.out_equiv`
`+ Definable‚ÇÅ`
`+ Definable‚ÇÅ.mk`
`+ Definable‚ÇÅ.mk_out`
`+ Definable‚ÇÅ.out`
`+ Definable‚ÇÅ.out_equiv`
`+ Definable‚ÇÇ`
`+ Definable‚ÇÇ.mk`
`+ Definable‚ÇÇ.mk_out`
`+ Definable‚ÇÇ.out`
`+ Definable‚ÇÇ.out_equiv`
`+ allZFSetDefinable`
`+ instance (f) [Definable‚ÇÅ f] (n g) [Definable n g] :`
`+ instance (f) [Definable‚ÇÇ f] (n g‚ÇÅ g‚ÇÇ) [Definable n g‚ÇÅ] [Definable n g‚ÇÇ] :`
`+ instance (n) (i) : Definable n (fun s ‚Ü¶ s i)`
`+ instance : Definable‚ÇÅ ({¬∑}) := .mk ({¬∑}) (fun _ ‚Ü¶ rfl)`
`+ instance : Definable‚ÇÇ insert := .mk insert (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ rfl)`
`+ instance : Definable‚ÇÇ pair := by unfold pair; infer_instance`
`- mapDefinableAux`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Is there any reason to keep `Function.OfArity` after this? It seems very clear that using `Fin n ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤` is strictly better.

> Is there any reason to keep `Function.OfArity` after this? It seems very clear that using `Fin n ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤` is strictly better.

You haven't replied to the above
I don't know if anyone needs it, but the relevant API is in two other files `Logic.Function.OfArity` and `Data.Fin.Tuple.Curry`. One of the files is not imported by `SetTheory.ZFC.Basic`.

Alright, I think the future of `Arity` is a question best saved for Zulip.

One last question: do you think this API could be useful for any other types? From what I understand, this notion of "definability" really only boils down to being able to provide a computable definition on the non-quotient types. If there's some other type where this is a relevant issue, then perhaps we could move out the `Definable` API into its own file.

Otherwise, LGTM.

Thanks! üöÄ

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
I don't recall any other obvious applications, but of course we can move it out if someone needs it.

Sorry for the delay, and thanks!

bors merge
This is so much nicer, thanks!
You should leave a docstring on this too.

```suggestion
  /-- Turns a definable function into an n-ary `PSet` function. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- An abbrev of `ZFSet.Definable` for unary functions. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- An abbrev of `ZFSet.Definable` for binary functions. -/
```

```suggestion
  mk_out xs : mk (out xs) = f (mk <| xs ¬∑) := by simp
```

```suggestion
```
Is there something wrong here?
Oh I'm sorry, mobile line-wrapping had me think there were two spaces here instead of one.

pullRequest.title: refactor(SetTheory/ZFC/Basic): redefine `Definable`
